info.name: Ignico API Documentation
info.description:
Each Ignico instance exposes API for developers to consume in their applications.

The API allows you to automate some tasks you typically would do through Ignico web app interface like:
- batch import of your data to your app,
- get your calculation results, user actions, rewards etc.

You can check here what resources you can interact with and how your requests should look like.



## Authorization

If you are a customer and have your own Ignico workspace set, you or one of your administrators have to create an API Key first.

To access any endpoint (except fetching access token) you have to be authorized. We use [The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749) to grant you access.



## Conventions

All communication is done in REST way and JSON format is used for each request and response.

Every endpoint conforms to open source JSON API 1.0 Specification. You can find everything you need to know about this format in official docs on http://jsonapi.org.



## Filtering

JSON API does not impose filtering params format (http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-filtering) so we chose to use it in array like notation.

To use a filter `someFilter` you need to send it as `filter[someFilter]=someValue` query parameter.

Of course you can combine multiple filters like this:

`?filter[someFilter]=someValue&filter[otherFilter]=otherValue`



## Pagination

JSON API is agnostic about pagination strategy (http://jsonapi.org/format/#fetching-pagination) too so we chose to use page-based strategy.

By default you will fetch first page and first 25 records (other default page size can be specified by endpoints). You can get information about total records count, current page or current page size from `meta` (http://jsonapi.org/format/#document-meta) information.

To fetch other pages or more data you need to send it as `page[number]=2&page[size]=10` query parameters.

Maximum page size may be limited and can be specified by endpoints to prevent sending too much data over single request.

item.name: Authorization
item.description:
To interact with other endpoints your requests have to be authorized using OAuth2 access token.

To obtain a token your application can get it in exchange for API Keys using client credentials grant (id and secret).

urlencoded.description: Currently this is the only one available grant type

request.description: Sign in using OAuth2 client credentials grant and fetch access token

**Available filters**

| Name                  | Type   | Description                                                                |
|-----------------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id                    | int    | Transaction ID                                                             |
| cancelled             | int    | Transaction cancel status (`1` = true, `0` = false)                        |
| realized              | int    | Transaction realize status (`1` = true, `0` = false)                       |
| type                  | int    | Can be `add`, `sub` or `period`		                                      |
| currency              | string | Original transaction currency e.g. `EUR`           	                	  |
| actualCurrency     	| string | Actual tranasction currency e.g. `USD`								      |
| amount				| string | Original transaction value e.g. `14.50` (before conversion `EUR` to `USD`) |
| actualAmount			| string | Actual transaction amount e.g `16.65` (after conversion `EUR` to `USD`)	  |
| addedAtGreaterEqual   | string | `>=` Date when Transaction was added (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |
| addedAtLessEqual		| string | `<=` Date when Transaction was added (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |

**Available sortings**

* id
* cancelled
* realized
* type
* currency
* actualCurrency
* amount
* actualAmount
* addedAt

item.name: Resources
item.description:
Manage or view your instance resources.

**All endpoints require Bearer access token.**

item.name: Actions
item.description:
Manage Actions that your users have taken.

May it be a sale, a lead, a meeting or any other activity you wish to use to reward your user.

request.description:
**Available filters**

| Name                    | Type   | Description                                                             |
|-------------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id                      | string | Action UUID                                                             |
| cancelled               | int    | 1 = true, 0 = false                                                     |
| performerEmail          | string | E-mail of user performing actions                                       |
| paramsValueGreaterEqual | mixed  | `>=` Value that can be compared with Action value (if exists)           |
| paramsValueLessEqual    | mixed  | `<=` Value that can be compared with Action value (if exists)           |
| takenAtGreaterEqual     | string | `>=` Date when Action was taken (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)     |
| takenAtLessEqual        | string | `<=` Date when Action was taken (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)     |
| cancelledAtGreaterEqual | string | `>=` Date when Action was cancelled (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format) |
| cancelledAtLessEqual    | string | `<=` Date when Action was cancelled (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format) |

**Available sortings**

* id
* cancelled
* takenAt
* createdAt

**Request parameters**

| Parameter                  | Type   | Description                               |
|----------------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------|
| type                       | string | `action`                                  |
| attributes.type            | string | Can be `transaction` or `event`           |
| attributes.title           | string | Title of the Action                       |
| attributes.takenAt         | string | Date when the Action was taken            |
| attributes.performer.email | int    | Email of User that performed the Action   |
| attributes.params.value    | mixed  | Value (only for `transaction` type)       |

**Available filters**

| Name                    | Type   | Description                                                             |
|-------------------------|--------|-------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id                      | int    | User ID                                                                 |
| email                   | string | Email of the searched user                                              |
| nameDisplay             | string | Name displayed eg Blanca Ojeda                                          |
| referralCode            | string | User referral code eg ES-M0IX80J7-21                                    |
| countryId               | string | Country code in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard                             |
| createdFrom        | string | `>=` Date when User was created (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)     |
| createdTo               | string | `<=` Date when User was created (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)     |
| active                  | int    | User activity status (1 = true, 0 = false)                              |
| activatedFrom           | string | `>=` Date when User was activated (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |
| activatedTo        | string | `<=` Date when User was activated (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |
| banned                  | int    | User ban status (1 = true, 0 = false)                                   |
| bannedFrom              | string | `>=` Date when User was activated (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |
| bannedTo           | string | `<=` Date when User was activated (`YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss` 24hr format)   |


**Available sortings**

* id
* email
* nameDisplay
* referralCode
* countryId
* createdAt
* active
* activatedAt
* banned
* bannedAt

**Required parameters**

| Parameter                  | Type   | Description                                 |
|----------------------------|--------|---------------------------------------------|
| type                       | string | Always will be `user` value                 |
| attributes.email           | string | User email                                  |
| attributes.country         | string | Country code in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 standard |

**Additional parameters**

Password

| Parameter                  | Type   | Description                                 |
|----------------------------|--------|---------------------------------------------|
| attributes.password        | string | User password                               |

If you omit the `password`, we will send the user an email with the link to set `password` on his own

--------------

Referrer

| Parameter                        | Type   | Description                                            |
|----------------------------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------------|
| attributes.referrer.email        | string | Email of the referring user                            |
| attributes.referrer.referralCode | string | ReferralCode of the referring user eg `PL-D9HC56H9-78` |

In the request you can use only one of the above parameters.

If you do not choose the `referrer`, the user will be assigned to the default referrer.

--------------

Account type - Person

| Parameter                                | Type   | Description                                            |
|------------------------------------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------------|
| attributes.subject.person.firstName      | string | Email of the referring user                            |
| attributes.subject.person.firstName      | string | ReferralCode of the referring user eg `PL-D9HC56H9-78` |

Account type - Company

| Parameter                                | Type   | Description                                            |
|------------------------------------------|--------|--------------------------------------------------------|
| attributes.subject.company.name          | string | Email of the referring user                            |

Account type - Company with representative person

| Parameter                                                  | Type   | Description                      |
|------------------------------------------------------------|--------|----------------------------------|
| attributes.subject.company.name                            | string | Company name                     |
| attributes.subject.company.representativeSubject.firstName | string | Representative person first name |
| attributes.subject.company.representativeSubject.lastName  | string | Representative person last name  |

If you do not choose the account type, user after logging in will be able to do it on his own.

response.name: Create a user with the referrer - Found by referralCode
Create a user with account type - Person
The simplest form of user registration
Create a user with account type - Company with representative person
Create a user with account type - Company
Create a user with the password and account type
Create a user with the referrer - Found by email
Create a user with the referrer and account type
Create a user with the referrer, password and account type
Create a user with the referrer and password

request.description:
**Available filters**

| Name                          | Type   | Description                                                          |
|-------------------------------|--------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| id                            | int    | Transaction ID                                                       |
| currency                      | string | Wallet currency e.g. `EUR`                                           |
| balanceCurrentGreaterEqual    | string | Available funds in the wallet are greater or equal than e.g. `14.50` |
| balanceCurrentLessEqual	    | string | Available funds in the wallet are less or equal than e.g. `14.50`    |
| balanceAccountingGreaterEqual | string | Wallet balance is greater or equal than e.g. `24.70`                 |
| balanceAccountingLessEqual	| string | Wallet balance is less or equal than e.g. `24.70`                    |

**Available sortings**

* id
* currency
* balanceCurrent
* balanceAccounting
